segments.cn: 作为成年人还是孩子？

segments.en: Because I know you've dressed up as an adult as well.
segments.cn: 因为我知道你作为成年人也打扮过。

segments.en: I dress up every year.
segments.cn: 我每年都打扮。

segments.en: I was Pippi Longstocking last year.
segments.cn: 我去年打扮成了长袜子皮皮。

segments.en: Well, as a child, one year, I dressed up as an injured soldier, because my dad was in the military, so we always had fatigues around the house, and so I used his fatigues and I put blood on my face and I had crutches, and people thought that I really had a broken leg,
segments.cn: 嗯，作为孩子，有一年，我打扮成受伤的士兵，因为我爸爸在军队，所以我们家总是有迷彩服，所以我用他的迷彩服，脸上涂了血，还拿着拐杖，人们以为我真的摔断了腿，

segments.en: so they used to give me double... that year they gave me double the candy, because I thought, oh, here's a poor girl in crutches.
segments.cn: 所以那一年他们给了我双倍的糖果，因为他们觉得，哦，这里有个可怜的女孩在拐杖上。

segments.en: And trick-or-treating.
segments.cn: 和“不给糖就捣蛋”。

segments.en: And my costume was an injured soldier, so they just didn't understand it.
segments.cn: 而我的服装是受伤的士兵，所以他们根本不理解。

segments.en: It's really funny.
segments.cn: 真的很有趣。

segments.en: Nice.
segments.cn: 不错。

segments.en: Well, we want to hear about you guys, if you go trick-or-treating, or if you dress up for Halloween.
segments.cn: 嗯，我们想听听你们的故事，如果你们去“不给糖就捣蛋”，或者如果你们为万圣节打扮。

segments.en: I know that many places around the world have parties or festivities for Halloween, and people dress up, so come to our website, EnglishPod.com, we'll see you guys there, and we'll see you guys next time.
segments.cn: 我知道世界上许多地方都有万圣节的派对或庆祝活动，人们会打扮，所以来我们的网站，EnglishPod.com，我们在那里见，下一次再见。

segments.en: Happy Halloween!
segments.cn: 万圣节快乐！

segments.en: Happy Halloween!
segments.cn: 万圣节快乐！
